Class: HLFConnection

(protected) HLFConnection(connectionManager, connectionProfile, businessNetworkIdentifier, connectOptions, client, channel, caClient)

Class representing a connection to a business network running on Hyperledger
Fabric, using the hfc module.

Constructor

(protected) new HLFConnection(connectionManager, connectionProfile, businessNetworkIdentifier, connectOptions, client, channel, caClient)

Constructor.

Parameters:
Name Type Description
connectionManager ConnectionManager

The owning connection manager.
connectionProfile string

The name of the connection profile associated with this connection
businessNetworkIdentifier string

The identifier of the business network for this connection,
or null if this connection if an admin connection
connectOptions object

The connection options in use by this connection.
client Client

A configured and connected Client object.
channel Chain

A configured and connected Chain object.
caClient FabricCAClientImpl

A configured and connected FabricCAClientImpl object.
Source:
  • hlfconnection.js, line 52

check the status of the Chaincode Listener and if it isn't registered then try to register one.

check the status of the event hubs and attempt to reconnect any event hubs.

createIdentity(securityContext, userID, optionsopt) → {Promise}

Create a new identity for the specified user ID.

Parameters:
Name Type Attributes Description
securityContext SecurityContext

The participant's security context.
userID string

The user ID.
options object <optional>

Options for the new identity.

Properties
Name Type Attributes Description
issuer boolean <optional>

Whether or not the new identity should have
permissions to create additional new identities. False by default.
affiliation string <optional>

Specify the affiliation for the new
identity. Defaults to 'org1'.
maxEnrollments string <optional>

Specify the maximum number of enrollments. Defaults to 0.
role string <optional>

Specify the role of the new identity. Defaults to 'client'.
attributes object <optional>

Specify other attributes for the identity
Source:
  • hlfconnection.js, line 988
Returns:

A promise that is resolved with a generated user
secret once the new identity has been created, or rejected with an error.

Type
Promise

getNativeAPI() → {*}

Get the native API for this connection. The native API returned is specific
to the underlying blockchain platform, and may throw an error if there is no
native API available.

Source:
  • hlfconnection.js, line 411
Throws:

if chaincode was not installed and told not to ignore this scenario

Type

login(identity, enrollmentSecret) → {Promise}

Login as a participant on the business network.

Parameters:
Name Type Description

The identity which represents the required crypto material.

The enrollment secret of the participant if required to obtain the
crypto material from a Certificate Authority.
